page.title: 05RELIGION
page.content: The district is served by two churches _ Sevington/Kingsnorth Church _ both have ancient foundations, the former standing on a Saxon site and being quoted in original Domesday. There are several free churches, including a Methodist at South Willesborough and a closed Chapel at Kingsnorth. There is a general fall_off in attendance and the Sevington Church is only used once a week. Sevington and Kingsnorth were built on higher ground, thus being safer from flooding and visible to the populace at large. Sevington Church stands in line with several other parish churches and there are stories that they were all used by 18th Century Smugglers to give warning!
